snippet: Michael Drewniak told New Jersey legislators that neither Gov. Chris Christie nor his closest advisers were involved in closing lanes to the George Washington Bridge.
abstract: Michael Drewniak, chief spokesman for New Jersey Gov Chris Christie, testifies he was misled about why lanes leading to George Washington Bridge were closed in September 2013; says neither Christie nor his closest advisers were involved.

byline.original: By KATE ZERNIKE and MARC SANTORA
byline.contributor: Kate Zernike reported from Trenton, and Marc Santora from New York.

lead_paragraph: Michael Drewniak told New Jersey legislators that neither Gov. Chris Christie nor his closest advisers were involved in closing lanes to the George Washington Bridge.

headline.main: Lane Closings Were ‘Idiotic,’ Christie Aide Testifies
headline.print_headline: Lane Closings Were ‘Idiotic,’ Christie’s Spokesman Tells Panel

keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
keywords.name: organizations
